subj-group.subject: The State of Postcolonial Studies continued
Responses to Dipesh Chakrabarty and Robert JC Young

title-group.article-title: The Sighs of History: Postcolonial Debris and the Question of (Literary) History

ref.mixed-citation: Ann Laura Stoler, "Imperial Debris: Reflections on Ruins and Ruination," Cultural Anthropology 23, no. 2 (2008): 191-219.
Ranajit Guha, "The Prose of Counter-Insurgency," in Selected Subaltern Studies, ed. Ranajit Guha and Gayatri Chakravorty Spivak (Oxford: Oxford Univ. Press, 1988), 45-88
Dipesh Chakrabarty, Provincializing Europe: Postcolonial Thought and Historical Difference, 2nd ed. (Princeton, NJ: Princeton Univ. Press, 2007).
Ira Raja and Deepika Bahri, "Key Journals and Institutions," in The Cambridge History of Postcolonial Literature, ed. Ato Quayson (Cam- bridge: Cambridge Univ. Press, 2012), 2:1151-88.
Ken Harrow's Thresholds of Change in African Literature: The Emergence of a Tradition (Portsmouth, NH: Heinemann, 1994).
E. San Juan, Jr., Beyond Postcolonial Theory (London: Palgrave Macmillan), 2000.
Robert Young, Postcolonialism: An Historical Introduction (Oxford: Blackwell, 2001).

Mario J. Valdes, "Rethinking the History of Literary History," in Rethinking Literary History: A Dialogue on Theory, ed. Linda Hutcheon and Mario J. Valdes (Oxford: Oxford Univ. Press, 2002), 67-68, italics added.
Sembene Ousmane, "In the Face of History," in Tribal Scars and Other Stories, trans. Len Ortzen (Portsmouth, NH: Heinemann, 1974), 18-21.
Quayson, "Periods versus Concepts: Space Making and the Ques- tion of Postcolonial Literary History," PMLA 127, no. 2 (2012).
Quayson, "Introduction: Postcolonial Literature in a Changing Historical Frame," in The Cambridge History of Postcolonial Literature, 1:16-20.
Sidney Mintz, Sweetness and Power: The Place of Sugar in Modem History (New York: Penguin, 1986), 32-34.
Niall Ferguson: Empire: The Rise and Demise of the British World Order- and the Lessons for Global Power (New York: Basic Books, 2002)
John Darwin, The Empire Project: The Rise and Fall of the British World-System, 1830-1970 (Cambridge: Cambridge Univ. Press, 2009).
Dharam P. Ghai and Yash P Ghai, eds., Portrait of a Minority: Asians in East Africa (Nairobi: Oxford Univ. Press, 1970)
Parminder Bhachu, Twice Migrants: East African Sikh Settlers in Britain (London: Tavistock, 1985).
Avtar Brah, Cartographies of Diaspora: Contesting Identities (London: Routledge, 1996), 181.

John McLeod, "Postcolonial Writing in Britain," Dominic Thomas, "Postcolonial Writing in France," and Sara Lennox, "Postcolonial Writing in Germany," in The Cambridge History of Postcolonial Literature 1:559-70, 1:571-601, and 1:620-48 respectively.
Kate Connolly, "Angela Merkel Declares Death of German Multiculturalism," The Guardian, October 17, 2010
Jamie Doward, "David Cameron's Attack on Multiculturalism Divides the Coalition," The Observer, February 5, 2011
"Sarkozy Declares Multicultural- ism had Failed," The Telegraph, February 11, 2011.
Axel Honneth's The Struggle for Recognition: The Moral Grammar of Social Conflicts (Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 1996).
Homi Bhabha, "Of Mimicry and Man," in The Location of Culture (London: Routledge, 1994), 85-92.
Johannes Fabian, Time and the Other: How Anthropology Makes its Object (New York: Columbia Univ. Press, 1983).
